question: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:

options.text: Ease up on the gas pedal.
Brake as hard as possible.
Turn off the ignition.

correct: Ease up on the gas pedal.
explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, release the accelerator or brake pedal to regain vehicle balance. Steer in the direction of the skid to regain control of the vehicle.

question: When passing another car, you have enough space to return to the driving lane:

options.text: If the other driver signals for you to re-enter the lane.
If you look over your shoulder and see the passed car behind you.
If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.

correct: If you can see both of the passed vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.
explanation: Before you return to the driving lane when completing a pass, be sure there is a safe gap between your vehicle and the passed vehicle. When you can see both headlights of the vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

question: To avoid last-minute moves, you should be looking down the road to where your vehicle will be in about:

options.text: 5 to 10 seconds.
10 to 15 seconds.
15 to 20 seconds.

correct: 10 to 15 seconds.
explanation: To avoid last-minute moves, you should scan the road 10 to 15 seconds ahead of your vehicle. This allows you to see hazards before meeting them.

question: U-turns in business districts are:

options.text: Always illegal because they are dangerous.
Legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.
Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.

correct: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.
explanation: In a business district, you may make a U-turn only at an intersection, unless a sign prohibits it, or where openings are provided for turns.

question: Roads are slippery after it first starts to rain. When the road is slippery, you should:

options.text: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
Test your tires' traction while going uphill.
Decrease the distance you look ahead of your vehicle.

correct: Avoid making turns and stops while driving at high speeds.
explanation: A wet, slippery road does not allow your tires the traction they need, so it is necessary to drive more slowly on a wet road than you would on a dry road. To reduce the risk of skidding, you should avoid fast turns or stops.

question: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:

options.text: Allowed from both directions.
Allowed only from your direction of travel.
Not allowed from either direction.

correct: Not allowed from either direction.
explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

question: You are merging onto an interstate highway. You should:

options.text: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
Merge across two lanes at once.
Always stop before entering the highway.

correct: Select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
explanation: Anytime you want to merge with other drivers, you need to find a gap large enough for you to safely enter into the flow of traffic. You should not stop on the entrance ramp to an interstate highway unless there are no gaps into which you may safely merge.

question: When can you drive in a bike lane?

options.text: 30 minutes after sunset or 30 minutes before sunrise
On foggy days when visibility is low
200 feet before making a turn

correct: 200 feet before making a turn
explanation: When you are making a right turn, you must enter the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner or driveway entrance. Do not drive in the bicycle lane at any other time

question: Blocking an intersection during "rush hour" traffic is not permitted:

options.text: Unless you entered the intersection on a green light.
Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.
Unless you have the right-of-way or a green light.

correct: Under any circumstances, even if your light is green.
explanation: Even if your light is green, you should not enter an intersection unless you can get completely across before the light turns red. You can be cited if you block the intersection.

question: If you are involved in a traffic collision, you are required to complete and submit a written report to the DMV:

options.text: Only if you or the other driver is injured.
If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
Only if you are at fault.

correct: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
explanation: If a collision results in death, any minor or major injury, or more than $1,000 in damage to anyone's property, each driver involved must file a report with the DMV within 10 days. In some cases, the driver's insurance agent, broker, or legal representative may file the report to represent the driver.

question: You must obey instructions from school crossing guards:

options.text: At all times.
Only during school hours.
Unless you do not see any children present.

correct: At all times.
explanation: Drivers should be alert to the presence of crossing guards when near a school and must always obey their instructions.

question: Two sets of solid double yellow lines that are two or more feet apart:

options.text: May be crossed to enter or exit a private driveway.
May not be crossed for any reason.
Should be treated as a separate traffic lane.

correct: May not be crossed for any reason.
explanation: Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced two or more feet apart are considered a barrier. You may not drive on or over this barrier, or make a left turn or U-turn across it, except at designated openings.

question: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should:

options.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.
Come to a complete stop as quickly as possible.
Stop and proceed only when the intersection is clear.

correct: Slow down and proceed with caution.
explanation: When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

question: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:

options.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.
If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
Under no circumstances.

correct: Under no circumstances.
explanation: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

question: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and:

options.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.
Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.
Keep your wheels facing straight.

correct: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.
explanation: When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:

options.text: Slow.
Stop.
Turn.

correct: Stop.
explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

question: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

options.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

correct: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
explanation: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

question: This white sign means you:

options.text: May turn left only on a green arrow.
May turn left on a green light when it is safe.
Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

correct: May turn left on a green light when it is safe.
explanation: A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.

question: A red arrow pointing to the right on a traffic light means you may:

options.text: Turn in that direction after slowing and checking for traffic.
Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.
Turn in that direction after you come to a complete stop.

correct: Not turn in that direction until the light turns green.
explanation: A red arrow means "stop." You must remain stopped until a green light or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow.

question: When you see this yellow sign, you should:

options.text: Always stop at the crosswalk.
Stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guards signals for you to go.
Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.

correct: Be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
explanation: A five-sided sign indicates that you are near a school. Be aware and stop if children are in the crosswalk.

question: This sign tells you that:

options.text: No turns are allowed on the road.
The road narrows ahead.
There is a series of curves ahead.

correct: There is a series of curves ahead.
explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming winding road.

question: Which of the following statements is true?

options.text: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.
Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.

correct: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
explanation: Driving too slowly can be dangerous because it may cause drivers behind you to become frustrated and make dangerous moves to pass you. It is safest to drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:

options.text: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
Always maintain your position.

correct: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
explanation: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you:

options.text: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.
Must yield to vehicles only on your right.
Should slow down but never stop.

correct: Must yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.
explanation: When approaching a yield sign, drivers must give the right-of-way to traffic already in the lanes that they intend to enter or cross. Drivers should be prepared to stop when approaching a yield sign but may continue without stopping if there is no conflicting traffic.

question: You are driving on a freeway with a posted speed limit of 65 mph. Traffic is traveling at 70 mph. You may legally drive:

options.text: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic.
Between 65 mph and 70 mph.
No faster than 65 mph.

correct: No faster than 65 mph.
explanation: On most California highways, the maximum speed limit is 65 mph. You may drive at 70 mph only if the speed limit is posted as such.

question: On a freeway, you should look farther ahead than you would on a city street:

options.text: In order to see potential hazards early.
Because it takes a quarter of a mile to stop your vehicle completely.
Because it helps you keep up with traffic.

correct: In order to see potential hazards early.
explanation: On the freeway, be ready for changes in traffic conditions. Watch for signals from other drivers. Expect merging vehicles at on-ramps and interchanges and be prepared for rapid changes in road conditions and traffic flow.

question: A white painted curb indicates a:

options.text: Loading zone for freight or passengers.
Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
Loading zone for freight only.

correct: Loading zone for passengers or mail only.
explanation: At a white painted curb, you may stop only long enough to pick up or drop off passengers or mail.

question: If a vehicle is equipped with airbags:

options.text: Seat belts should still be worn.
Seat belts do not need to be worn.
Seat belts should be worn behind the back.

correct: Seat belts should still be worn.
explanation: Airbags are important safety devices that provide protection in crashes. For best protection, a vehicle's lap and shoulder belts should be used in combination with airbags.

question: A person may legally ride in the back of a pickup truck when:

options.text: The sides of the pickup bed are at least 24 inches high.
The back of the pickup is covered with a camper shell.
In a secured seat and while using an approved safety belt.

correct: In a secured seat and while using an approved safety belt.
explanation: Do not allow a person to ride in the back of a pickup or other truck unless the vehicle is equipped with seats and the person uses both the seat and a safety belt.

question: A curb painted blue means parking is:

options.text: Allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.
Only allowed when picking up or dropping off passengers.
For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

correct: For disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
explanation: A blue curb indicates an area where parking is permitted only for a disabled person, or driver of a disabled person, who displays a placard or special license plate for disabled persons or disabled veterans.

question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:

options.text: Slow down because the lane ends ahead.
Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
Change lanes and maintain your current speed.

correct: Be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
explanation: As you enter a work zone, signs and message boards will warn you of workers, slow-moving equipment, and/or closed lanes ahead. You should reduce your speed and be prepared to slow down or stop.

question: When using a roundabout, drivers should:

options.text: Stop in the middle of the roundabout.
Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
Yield to entering traffic.

correct: Yield to traffic already in the roundabout.
explanation: A roundabout is a circular intersection that usually does not include a traffic signal and flows in a counterclockwise direction around a central island. Motorists must enter from the right, yielding to traffic already in the roundabout, and follow the circle to the right until the desired roadway is reached.

question: This white sign means:

options.text: The railroad crossing is controlled. Continue at your regular speed.
Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
Stop at the railroad tracks and wait for a signal before crossing.

correct: Look, listen, and prepare to stop at the crossing if necessary.
explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must look, listen, slow down, and prepare to stop. Let any trains pass before you proceed.

question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?

options.text: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.

correct: Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

question: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

options.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
At the legal speed limit.
More slowly than the freeway traffic.

correct: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
explanation: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

question: This road sign means:

options.text: Sharp turn to the right ahead.
Upcoming sharp left and right turns.
Winding road ahead.

correct: Winding road ahead.
explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns the driver that there is an upcoming winding road. Speed should be adjusted appropriately.

question: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

options.text: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.

correct: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
explanation: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

question: This sign means:

options.text: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
Slow-moving vehicle.
No U-turn.

correct: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

question: Before changing lanes or attempting to pass another vehicle, you should:

options.text: Check your blind spots and mirrors.
Signal your intention before changing lanes.
All of the above.

correct: All of the above.
explanation: Every time you want to change lanes or otherwise move your vehicle to the right or left, signal to alert other drivers to your intentions. Always check your mirrors and turn your head to check your blind spot before attempting any lateral move.

question: If you are driving and you see animals standing near the roadway:

options.text: Speed up to scare them away.
Slow down and proceed with caution.
Quickly swerve into the next lane.

correct: Slow down and proceed with caution.
explanation: Slow down and proceed with caution if you see animals that are standing near the roadway. They may unexpectedly bolt or change direction at the last moment. Some animals travel in packs, so there may be more animals just out of sight that are also near the road.

question: If you are about to be hit from the rear, you should not:

options.text: Release your seat belt.
Brace yourself.
Press your head against the head restraint.

correct: Release your seat belt.
explanation: If your vehicle is hit from the rear while you are in forward motion, your body will be thrown backward. Brace yourself by pressing against the back of your seat and putting your head against the head restraint to prevent whiplash. Maintain a firm grip on the steering wheel and be ready to apply your brakes to avoid being pushed into another vehicle.

question: This sign means:

options.text: All traffic must turn left.
No left turn.
No U-turn.

correct: No left turn.
explanation: This sign means drivers cannot make a left turn. It is unsafe and unlawful to make a left turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

question: This road sign means:

options.text: Bicycle crossing.
Stop only if other cars are approaching.
Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.

correct: Bicycle crossing.
explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. These signs alert drivers to areas where bicycles may be crossing.

question: This road sign means:

options.text: No right turn.
No U-turns.
No left turn.

correct: No right turn.
explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws and must be obeyed. Where this sign is posted, making a right turn is prohibited.

question: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:

options.text: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
Look for a second train.
Both of the above.

correct: Both of the above.
explanation: Even after a train passes, watch out for a second train approaching on any track. Do not proceed until all gates have been lifted and all warning signals have stopped flashing.

question: When driving on the highway, consistently looking far ahead of your vehicle:

options.text: Helps you keep up with traffic.
Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
Allows you to spot upcoming police officers.

correct: Reduces the need for last-minute braking or turning.
explanation: To avoid the need for last-minute braking or turning, consistently watch the road far ahead of your vehicle. By looking ahead and being ready to stop or change lanes if needed, you can drive more safely, save fuel, and help keep traffic moving at a steady pace.
